Defines

#define STATS_MAX_MSB   24
 the largest msb used to address a bucket range

#define STATS_BUCKET_SHIFT   4
 number of bits < msb to address a bucket

#define STATS_NUM_MODES   16
 number of modes to use for weighted avg

#define STATS_IGNORE_THRESHOLD   256
 Any mode smaller that this (as a fraction of the total number of datapoints) will be ignored in the computation of the weighted more averages.

#define STATS_BUCKETS   (1 << STATS_BUCKET_SHIFT )
 number of buckets per range

#define STATS_BUCKET_MASK   (STATS_BUCKETS - 1)
 mask to look at just the bucket index

#define STATS_MAX_BUCKET_RANGE   (STATS_MAX_MSB-STATS_BUCKET_SHIFT)
 number of bucket ranges

typedef T_stats_mode T_stats_modes [STATS_NUM_MODES]

Detailed Description

Types and default settings for "stats_" Simple Approximate Statitistics Package.

Define Documentation

#define STATS_IGNORE_THRESHOLD   256
 

Any mode smaller that this (as a fraction of the total number of datapoints) will be ignored in the computation of the weighted more averages.

NOTE: this is a fairly arbitrary number 100 and 1000 look as good of choices, but this seemed like a way to catch the true "flyers" without ignoring real data

size_t    count,
char *    name,
T_stats_result *    result

Computes the modes and averages from the current statistics record.

Parameters:
